channel.title: Brandon Boswell

item.title: Digital Garden
item.description: I probably should be actually gardening so that I get more Vitamin D, but I really enjoy Digital Gardening
item.content:encoded: I probably should be actually gardening so that I get more Vitamin D, but I really enjoy Digital Gardening

item.title: Daily Reflection
item.description: On each daily note I have a slot for reflection. The template I’ve used for a while now is: Reflection What did I learn / accomplish? * What did I do for exercise?
item.content:encoded:
On each daily note I have a slot for reflection. The template I’ve used for a while now is:

Reflection

  • What did I learn / accomplish? *

  • What did I do for exercise?

  • Any special thoughts? *

  • How could I have made today better? *

It is nice and thorough, but I’ve found myself more and more not doing daily reflection because it pulls away from other things that need my attention, so today I’m trying swapping it to just a single line: “Today was a good day because:”

References

item.title: Knowing when to put down a book
item.description: Writer Doris Lessing on how to choose what to read: “There is only one way to read, which is to browse in libraries and bookshops, picking up books that attract you, reading only those, dropping them when they bore you, skipping the parts that drag – and never, never reading anything because you feel you ought, or because it is part of a trend or a movement.
item.content:encoded: Writer Doris Lessing on how to choose what to read: “There is only one way to read, which is to browse in libraries and bookshops, picking up books that attract you, reading only those, dropping them when they bore you, skipping the parts that drag – and never, never reading anything because you feel you ought, or because it is part of a trend or a movement. Remember that the book which bores you when you are twenty or thirty will open doors for you when you are forty or fifty-and vise versa. Don’t read a book out of its right time for you.”

item.title: If you expect there to be time and energy at the end of the day for your daily highlight you are setting yourself up for failure
item.content:encoded:
References

Four Thousand Weeks

item.title: it is easier to give advice than to take it yourself
